member.name: T:Rug.Osc.OscAddressRegexCache
member.summary: Regex cache is an optimisation for regexes for address patterns. Caching is enabled by default.
member.remarks:
This mechanism assumes that the same addresses will be used multiple times and that there will be a finite number of unique addresses parsed over the course of the execution of the program.
If there are to be many unique addresses used of the course of the execution of the program then it maybe desirable to disable caching.

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.OscAddressRegexCache.Clear
member.summary: Clear the entire cache

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.OscAddressRegexCache.Aquire(System.String)
member.summary: Aquire a regex, either by creating it if no cached one can be found or retrieving a cached one
member.returns: a regex created from or retrieved for the pattern

member.name: P:Rug.Osc.OscAddressRegexCache.Enabled
member.summary: Enable regex caching for the entire program (Enabled by default)

member.name: P:Rug.Osc.OscAddressRegexCache.Count
member.summary: The number of cached regex(s)

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.OscReceiver.TryReceive(Rug.Osc.OscPacket@)
member.summary: Try to receive a osc message, this method is non-blocking and will return imediatly with a message or null
member.param: an osc message if one is ready else null if there are none
member.returns: true if a message was ready

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.OscReceiver.Receive
member.summary: Receive a osc message, this method is blocking and will only return once a message is recived
member.returns: an osc message

member.name: T:Rug.Osc.EnumHelper
member.summary: Enum Helper class orginal code by Simon Mourier codefluententities.com http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1082532/how-to-tryparse-for-enum-value

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.EnumHelper.TryParse``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of an enum to its Enum equivalent value. A return value indicates whether the operation succeeded. This method does not rely on Enum.Parse and therefore will never raise any first or second chance exception.
member.param: The input text. May be null.
When this method returns, contains Enum equivalent value to the enum contained in input, if the conversion succeeded.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rug.Osc.EnumHelper.TryParse``1(System.String,System.Boolean,``0@)

ignore the case of the input string
When this method returns, contains Enum equivalent value to the enum contained in input, if the conversion succeeded.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
